title: Shrimp with Lobster Sauce Recipe
description: Make shrimp with lobster sauce at home with stir-fried shrimp and pork in a sweet and salty sauce made with soy, sugar, and egg. That's right, no lobster!
body: ​ Skip to content Allrecipes Search Please fill out this field. Search the site Please fill out this field. About Us The Allrecipes Allstars How to Add a Recipe GET THE MAGAZINE Recipes Global Cuisines Asian Chinese Shrimp with Lobster Sauce 4.4 (172) 137 Reviews 19 Photos This shrimp with lobster sauce is just like what you'd find at a Chinese restaurant that serves Cantonese cuisine. Despite the name, there's no lobster in the sauce. Serve over white rice. Submitted by MURF65 Updated on December 22, 2022 Save Rate Print Share Close Add Photo 19 19 19 19 Prep Time: 5 mins Cook Time: 20 mins Total Time: 25 mins Servings: 4 Jump to Nutrition Facts Cook Mode (Keep screen awake) Ingredients 1x 2x 4x Oops! Something went wrong. Our team is working on it. Original recipe (1X) yields 4 servings 1 ½ teaspoons cornstarch 2 teaspoons cooking sherry 1 pound medium shrimp - peeled and deveined ¼ cup vegetable oil 2 cloves garlic, minced ¼ pound ground pork 1 cup water 2 tablespoons soy sauce ¼ teaspoon sugar ½ teaspoon salt ¼ cup cold water 1 ½ tablespoons cornstarch 1 large egg, beaten Directions Dissolve 1 1/2 teaspoons cornstarch in sherry in a medium bowl. Add shrimp and toss to coat. Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Add shrimp and stir-fry until pink, 3 to 5 minutes. Use a slotted spoon to transfer shrimp to a plate; leave as much oil in the wok as possible. Add garlic to the wok and stir-fry for a few seconds, then add ground pork. Stir-fry until pork is no longer pink, 3 to 5 minutes. Mix 1 cup water, soy sauce, sugar, and salt together in a small bowl; pour into the wok and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to medium, and simmer for about 2 minutes. Whisk 1/4 cup cold water and 1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch together in a small bowl; pour into the wok. Add shrimp and bring to a simmer. Drizzle beaten egg into the wok, stirring quickly as it cooks. Serve immediately. I Made It Print 236 home cooks made it! Add Your Photo Photos of Shrimp with Lobster Sauce 01 of 19 Photo by  twoyorkiesmom 02 of 19 Photo by  Todd Schrock 05/15/2021 Easy to make and turned out great. I have been searching for a recipe like this for a while. I hope I can find a Cantonese recipe for an authentic sweet and sour recipe for sweet and sour duck. The breading on the one I grew up on was crispy and very dark in color on a chunk of pulled duck. Never been a le to find anything like it. Sadly the restaurant I grew up with has long since closed. If anyone knows of a recipe similar please let me know. TS 03 of 19 Photo by  Randrea 09/12/2020 04 of 19 Photo by  Laurielynn Vilale 05/31/2020 05 of 19 Photo by  Patricia 04/02/2020 06 of 19 Photo by  Mia Win 12/24/2019 07 of 19 Photo by  Shannon Musgrove 11/08/2019 Amazing!Nothing compares to this dish made to my exact taste! Pretty as the picture! More delicious than pictured!! 08 of 19 Photo by  carmicjam 10/08/2019 This was so easy to make, nice and light and tasty. 09 of 19 Photo by  Autumneyes 10/14/2018 Very satisfied with this dish! name: MURF65

Use a slotted spoon to transfer shrimp to a plate; leave as much oil in the wok as possible.;Add garlic to the wok and stir-fry for a few seconds, then add ground pork. Stir-fry until pork is no longer pink, 3 to 5 minutes.;Mix 1 cup water, soy sauce, sugar, and salt together in a small bowl; pour into the wok and stir to combine. Bring to a boil, then cover, reduce the heat to medium, and simmer for about 2 minutes.;Whisk 1/4 cup cold water and 1 1/2 tablespoons cornstarch together in a small bowl; pour into the wok. Add shrimp and bring to a simmer. Drizzle beaten egg into the wok, stirring quickly as it cooks. Serve immediately.
